text: The 2009 Sacramento State Hornets football team represented Sacramento State UniversityThe official name of Sacramento State has been California State University, Sacramento since 1972. However, it is still commonly known as Sacramento State. during the 2009 NCAA Division I FCS football season. Sacramento State competed in the Big Sky Conference. The Hornets were led by third-year head coach Marshall Sperbeck and played home games at Hornet Stadium in Sacramento, California. They finished the season with a record of five wins and six losses (5–6, 4–4 Big Sky). Sacramento State was outscored by its opponents 274–371 for the season. ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL== No Sacramento State players were selected in the 2010 NFL Draft. ==Notes== ==References== Sacramento State Category:Sacramento State Hornets football seasons Sacramento State Hornets football
title: 2009 Sacramento State Hornets football team
